intro: Mediocalcar compressicalcar, commonly known as the narrow-lobed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Mediocalcar compressicalcar is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats.
